title: The Festival of Fractures
outcome: A spontaneous festival erupts in the city center, turning rebellion against the BCI into a public celebration. Myths, performances, and hacked prompts transform Stenograd into a carnival of voices. The Council loses legitimacy as citizens create a joyous, fractured community.

events.description: A spontaneous festival erupts in the city center, with street art, performances, and live hacking exposing the BCI’s flaws. Revelers mock compliance routines, celebrating their irrelevance.
The Council condemns the gathering as sedition, but crowds swell and the event spreads across smaller districts. Rada Miskovic covers it as a historic turning point.
Hacked BCI prompts become public games. Citizens openly manipulate their scores, forging 'forgiveness circles' and fake compliance streaks. Trust shifts to community over algorithm.
Formerly marginalized groups lead parades and storytelling sessions, reclaiming their histories once erased by the BCI. Myth and truth entwine as past compliance records are set ablaze.
The Council’s authority collapses in the face of mass joy and connection. As the festival ends, Stenograd stands united in chaos—governed by celebration, not control.
